definition: an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc

sentences.english: The short horse gets a passport to the fort.
sentences.chinese: 小矮马有一张关卡堡垒的通行证。

sentences.english: Swimming A Fort Lauderdale swimmer releases the air in his lungs underwater.
sentences.chinese: 劳德戴尔堡垒游泳者在水下面释放他肺中的空气。

sentences.english: The last bastion will be the home.
sentences.chinese: 我们的家成了最后一个堡垒。

sentences.english: It was the last holdout, ' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，那是最后一处堡垒。

sentences.english: The army retreated from the ruined fortress .
sentences.chinese: 军队撤离了倒毁的堡垒。
敌人包围了他们的堡垒。

sentences.english: Built in 1938, the top-secret bunker was codenamed Paddock.
sentences.chinese: 建于1938年的最高机密地下堡垒代号“围场”。

sentences.english: The talks would be held at a Union fort on the Chesapeake Bay.
sentences.chinese: 此次会谈在切萨皮克湾的一个北方军事堡垒中举行。

sentences.english: The original fortress expanded steadily until it started to host governmental affairs.
sentences.chinese: 最初的堡垒稳步扩张，直到它开始主掌政府事务处理。

sentences.english: The battle fortress containing the Protoculture matrix is not among them.
sentences.chinese: 装有史前文化矩阵的战斗堡垒不在它们中间。

sentences.english: The Southwest Associated University was dubbed a bastion of democracy in the southwestern year.
sentences.chinese: 西南联大被称为西南后方的“民主堡垒。”

sentences.english: I will be your fortress, tall and strong.
sentences.chinese: 我会成为妳的堡垒，高大又坚强。

sentences.english: Thought to have been a pict stronghold it was chartered c. 1200. Population.
sentences.chinese: 曾被人认为是皮克特人的堡垒，1200年特许设立。

sentences.english: Third, Mr Sarkozy is ready to confront France's bastions of conservatism.
sentences.chinese: 第三，萨科齐先生准备好面对法国保守主义的堡垒。

sentences.english: The fort fell into the enemy's hands without a shot being fired.
sentences.chinese: 一枪未发堡垒就陷落敌手。

sentences.english: Barracks house recruits and garrison troops in some small comfort, but then the life of soldier is supposed to be hard.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒军营的生活较为舒适，但戍卫生涯依然枯燥如旧。

definition: defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
pillbox (military fortification)/blockhouse/euphemistic way of writing 屌爆[diao3 bao4]
